page.title: 19MONKS, ROAD NAMES
page.content: Monks from{Worth School}become involved in many aspects of the community. One goes to Gatwick and helps out as a chaplain. Another would be the co-ordinator in the event of a nuclear war so the Abbey is part of a radio network for the whole of Sussex. The Abbot is Abbot President over the English Benedictine Community. He wishes the Abbey to be an ecumenical centre for Sussex and further afield. The{High Street}is so called because it runs along a ridge and is quite literally high. Crawley Lane runs south from the High Street. It once ran north past Greentrees Farm right through to Crawley. Recently there was an attempt to change the name which was resisted by some local people so the name remains the same.
